item.title: Extracting Hacker News Book Recommendations with the ChatGPT API
item.description: I love books and I enjoy reading through the Hacker News(HN) book recommendation threads. On HN, there’s almost 200 stories so far this year that have the separate word “book” in the title, and aren’t linked to another page. item.title: Microsoft Teams reply spoofing: Trolling your friends and colleagues - STM Cyber Blog
item.description: Earlier this year, we discovered an interesting behavior in Microsoft Teams chat functionality that allowed us to phish our coworkers and earn a free pizza. By modifying the request it’s possible to change various parameters of the message we’re replying to, i.e., its content, time of creation, and author.

item.title: I don't want to know IPs: encryption in TORRENTDYNE
item.description: A few days ago I released TORRENTDYNE, a BitTorrent implementation checker. While working on it, I hit a wall: how do you make a service like this useful AND appropriately private? I ended up using a heap of cryptographic tools, but it did take me some time to figure out. I haven't seen too many clean slate encryption design reports, so here's my contribution.
